text: A cross-sectional study (n = 130) was conducted to identify diabetic patient's attitudes, patient portal feature preferences, and e-health literacy at two tertiary hospitals in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. 51% of patients had positive attitude towards the patient portal, 82% think a portal could help with self-care management. 53% of patients had low e-health literacy levels and 9% had high e-health literacy levels. The majority of the study sample have a positive attitude with low e-health literacy levels.
title: Saudi Diabetic Patients' Attitudes Towards Patient Portal Use and Their Perceived E-Health Literacy.
journal: Studies in health technology and informatics
